critique: This document pertains to the Code of Fair Competition for the Bituminous Coal Industry during the New Deal era. It focuses on the appointment of an administrator to code authorities within the coal industry. Given the context of the New Deal, the document likely leans towards government intervention in the economy. There's no direct indication of ideological tilt, immigration, executive power, federalism, security/liberty, or social inclusion. The primary focus is economic regulation through industry codes.
